update.description:
Click on `Add` on the palette and choose an SVG file to extrude.

![extruded2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3987015382-extruded2.png)

![extruded1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/592780571-extruded1.png)

* `SVGLoader` fix courtesy of @hugomatic

* `Visual` fix courtesy of @iche033

* Known issues:

    * Models made with the editor don't collide with ground plane and will fall through (#1492)

    * Polyline materials missing normals and texture coordinates (#1485)

    * Not possible to extrude SVG paths which:

        * Have too many points/samples

        * Have crossed lines
update.title: Model Editor: Dialog to extrude SVG files into polyline links

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Dialog to extrude SVG files into polyline links

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Dialog to extrude SVG files into polyline links

content.raw:
One of the things we're not supporting at the moment are [transforms in SVGs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/transform), which causes certain meshes to show up translated far away from the origin in unpredictable ways. That's why I'm centring it. 

But as you've pointed out before, ideally we will eventually support all possible transforms and use the user-defined centre.
content.html:
One of the things we're not supporting at the moment are transforms in SVGs, which causes certain meshes to show up translated far away from the origin in unpredictable ways. That's why I'm centring it.

But as you've pointed out before, ideally we will eventually support all possible transforms and use the user-defined centre.

content.raw:
I see a compiler warning on OS X in SVGLoader_TEST.cc (not caused by this PR, but vaguely related?):
~~~
/Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/gazebo/common/SVGLoader_TEST.cc:60:3: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'testing::internal::EqHelper<false>::Compare<int, unsigned long>' requested here
  EXPECT_EQ(3, paths.size());
  ^
~~~
content.html:
I see a compiler warning on OS X in SVGLoader_TEST.cc (not caused by this PR, but vaguely related?):

/Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/gazebo/common/SVGLoader_TEST.cc:60:3: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'testing::internal::EqHelper<false>::Compare<int, unsigned long>' requested here
  EXPECT_EQ(3, paths.size());
  ^
